nodes.name: Pseudo Plasma Spark Room Left Door (to Bug Room)

runways.name: Base Runway - Pseudo Plasma Spark Room Left Door (to Bug Room)

strats.name: Pseudo Plasma Spark Out Left
strats.note: Charge near node 2 then climb up and spark out of the left door.

strats.name: Pseudo Plasma Charge Out Left
strats.note: Charge near node 2 then climb out and carry the spark through the left door.

nodes.name: Pseudo Plasma Spark Room Bottom Door (to Crab Shaft)
Missile (yellow Maridia false wall)
Pseudo Plasma Spark Room Water Level Junction

strats.name: Suitless Shinespark
strats.note: Spark diagonally from the right side of the doorway.
devNote: It is possible to spark through the doorway, but diagonal sparks are not supported.
There is no gravity version, as Gravity + Speedbooster is enough to get up.

strats.name: Cross Room Jump - Speed Jump to the Top
note: Using SpeedBooster in the room below and the full length of the runway (starting with Samus hanging over the edge as far as possible), run and jump precisely to make it through without bonking the door frame.
Break spin before the transition to expand Samus' hitbox and trigger the transition earlier, retaining more speed and also making it easier to avoid bonking.
Hold left through the transition to initiate a turn-around while entering the room.
Land on the small platform at the top of the room.
strats.devNote: This strat is applicable only with the Post Crocomire Jump Room.

strats.name: Cross Room Jump - Tricky Dash Jump to the Top
note: Using SpeedBooster in the room below, start running at a precise position to be able to jump during a spike in the speed-to-jumpHeight chart.
Break spin before the transition to expand Samus' hitbox and trigger the transition early, retaining more speed and also making it easier to avoid bonking.
Hold left through the transition to initiate a turn-around while entering the room.
Land on the small platform at the top of the room.
strats.devNote: This strat is applicable with Crocomire's Room and the Post Crocomire Jump Room.

strats.name: Suitless Frozen Skultera
strats.note: The fish can safely be damaged from the door until they are ready to be used as platforms.

strats.name: Suitless Shinespark to the Ledge
strats.note: Spark vertically by the first plant on the right to hit the floating island.
devNote: It is possible to spark diagonally from the door and hit the island, requiring fewer frames remaining, but it's starting position is somewhat precise and uses a bit more energy.
There is no gravity version, as Gravity + Speedbooster is enough to get up.

strats.name: Cross Room Jump - Standing Jump
note: Standing on the platform in the room below, jump up and press right against the door frame through the transition.
devNote: This strat only works for platforms that are 6 tiles below the door transition (which is the closest distance that occurs in the vanilla game).
A crouch jump can be used but is not required.
A spin jump also works but requires a precise down grab.

strats.name: Cross Room Jump - Space Jump
note: Use Space Jump to enter with rightward momentum and moderate vertical speed.
This can be done by using Space Jump at an appropriate height and pressing against the right side of the door frame while entering the transition.

strats.name: Cross Room Jump - HiJump Spin Jump
note: Spin jump from the platform in the room below, pressing right against the door frame through the transition.
devNote: For a platform 9 tiles below the door transition, a standing jump also works (instead of a spin jump).

strats.name: Cross Room Jump - HiJump Crouch Jump
note: Standing on the platform in the room below, crouch jump up and press right against the door frame through the transition.
devNote: This strat only works for platforms that are 10 tiles below the door transition (Crocomire's Room).

It could be done for a platform 9 tiles below the door transition, but this would require a momentum-conserving turn-around; it is easier to just do a standing jump or spin jump in that case instead of crouch jumping.

strats.name: Cross Room Jump - HiJump Spin Jump Turnaround
note: Spin jump from the platform in the room below, pressing right against the door frame through the transition.
Perform a momentum-conserving turn-around to make it around the corner of the ledge above.
devNote: This strat is for platforms that are exactly 7 tiles below the door transition.
For platforms that are 8 or 9 tiles below, no turn-around is needed.

strats.name: Cross Room Jump - HiJump Running Jump
note: Run left-to-right and spin jump from the platform in the room below, passing through the transition without bonking the door.
devNote: This is applicable using the Power Bomb block platform in PCJR or the normal platform in Tourian Escape Room 2.

strats.name: Cross Room Jump - Spring Ball Jump Above
note: Standing on the platform in the room below, jump up (crouch jump makes it easier) and press right against the door frame through the transition.
After the transition, perform a spring ball jump mid-air to reach the ledge.

strats.name: Cross Room Jump - Spring Ball Jump Below
note: Standing on the platform in the room below, perform a spring ball jump mid-air a few tiles below the transition.
Hold right through the transition, and do not bonk the door frame.
strats.devNote: For height 8 specifically, it is challenging to morph soon enough to spring ball jump as low as necessary.

strats.name: Cross Room Jump - Speed Jump
note: Using SpeedBooster in the room below, run and jump, pressing against the right side of the door frame through the transition.
You may need to use less runway than is available, to avoid getting too much vertical speed.
devNote: This strat is applicable in Crocomire's Room and the Post Crocomire Jump Room.

Sufficient vertical speed could be obtained with fewer tiles, but it would require jumping further to the right (i.e., increasing minRightPosition) which would not work in PCJR unless the PB blocks are broken;
since there doesn't yet appear to be any application, we don't add a separate case for that.

strats.name: Cross Room Jump - Low Wall Jump
note: Do a wall jump from the right side of the door frame, three tiles below the door transition.
Turn back around to the right before the transition, while maintaining spin.
devNote: This strat requires a door frame with a three-tile-high surface usable for wall jumping (not including the door transition tiles).
Many door frames only have a two-tile-high surface.

strats.name: Cross Room Jump - Low Wall Jump Turnaround
note: Do a low spin jump and press against the right side of the door frame.
Wall jump as low as possible, jumping as soon as possible after moving away from the wall.
Immediately turn back to the right and try to press against the door frame again before the transition, while maintaining spin.
After the transition, typically a momentum-conserving turnaround is needed to avoid bonking.
devNote: This strat is for cases where the door frame below has only a two-tile-high surface available for wall-jumping.
If a third tile is available, the jump can be done more easily.

strats.name: Base
strats.note: Wait for the fish to swim left where they can safely be killed.

strats.name: Crouch Jump Down Grab Escape
strats.note: Crouch jump + down grab only works as a way out of the water on the right side.

strats.name: Wall Jump Escape
strats.note: Perform a precise wall jump as the water is lowering.  Climbing up the right side of the room is slightly easier.

strats.name: Space Jump Bounce
strats.note: Kill the Choot, then space jump across the water and onto the center platform - it is slightly lower than the sides.

nodes.name: Northwest Maridia Bug Room Left Door (to Watering Hole)

runways.name: Base Runway - Northwest Maridia Bug Room Left Door (to Watering Hole)

strats.name: Bug Room Spark Out Left with Hijump
strats.note: Charge a spark below towards the right then run back and jump up and spark out of the left door.

strats.name: Bug Room Spark Out Left HiJumpless
strats.note: Charge a spark below towards the right then run back and jump up and spark out of the left door.

strats.name: Bug Room Charge Out Left with Hijump
strats.note: Charge a spark left and use the last bit of platform to jump up to the ledge above.

nodes.name: Northwest Maridia Bug Room Right Door (to Pseudo Plasma Spark)

runways.name: Base Runway - Northwest Maridia Bug Room Right Door (to Pseudo Plasma Spark)

strats.name: Bug Room Charge Out Right (Gravityless)
note: Charge below node 1 then carry the spark through the morph tunnel and out the right door.
This is a lot trickier without Gravity because the tide must be timed correctly.

strats.name: Bug Room Charge Out Right (Gravity)
note: Charge below node 1 then carry the spark through the morph tunnel and out the right door.
This is easier with Gravity because the tide won't interfere.

canLeaveCharged.devNote: mustOpenDoorFirst is false because the door can be shot before initiating the spark.

nodes.name: Northwest Maridia Bug Room Central Junction

strats.name: Maridia Bug Room MidAir Morph with Gravity
note: With Gravity, it's possible to move forward and mid-air morph into the morph passage.
The momentum can push Samus into the tunnel, no need to press forward while in mid-air.

strats.name: Maridia Bug Room Suitless MidAir Morph
Maridia Bug Room Frozen Menu Bridge
note: Freeze one of the Menus (bugs) in a position where you can use it to get into the morph passage.
One of the easier methods is with a damage boost. Stand in the water, take a hit for positioning, and freeze the bug near but left of Samus.
Then morph on top and damage boost into the morph tunnel as it unfreezes.

strats.name: Base
strats.devNote: The menus don't really matter with these strats.

strats.name: Kill the Menus
strats.devNote: The Menus are relatively hard to dodge, and would end up with the same requirements as killing them with the Power Beam.

nodes.name: Watering Hole Door (to Bug Room)

runways.name: Base Runway - Watering Hole Door (to Bug Room)

nodes.name: Super Missile (yellow Maridia)
Missile (yellow Maridia super missile)
Watering Hole Junction (Bottom of Water)

farmCycles.name: Half-screen back and forth
farmCycles.note: Running back and forth with proper timing can be a bit faster than camping just one of them

strats.name: Suitless Springball Jump
strats.note: This is a max height springball jump.
strats.devNote: FIXME add a slightly easier variant that damage boosts off of the Choot.

strats.name: Naked Watering Hole Escape
strats.note: A stationary spinjump can fit into the 1 tile wide hole where Samus can slowly infinite walljump to freedom.

nodes.name: Plasma Spark Room Left Door (to Toilet)

locks.name: Plasma Spark Room Green Lock (to Toilet)

nodes.name: Plasma Spark Room Bottom Right Door (to Butterfly Room)

nodes.name: Plasma Spark Room Top Right Door (to Kassiuz Room)

runways.name: Base Runway - Plasma Spark Room Top Right Door (to Kassiuz Room)

locks.name: Plasma Spark Room Grey Lock (to Kassiuz Room)

nodes.name: Plasma Spark Room Top Junction
nodes.devNote: This exists mostly in case it ends up being helpful for handling walljumps later

strats.name: Shinespark
strats.note: Spark vertically to avoid hitting the right ledge.

strats.name: Suitless Shinespark
note: Start the dash as close to the door transition as possible to help avoid getting hit by the first Owtch. Store the shine charge while high up on the left slope.
Spark up while on the right side of the platform. To avoid the Owtch on the platform, it may help to jump on the left side of the platform then jump again and spark midair above the right side.

strats.name: Plasma Spark Fish Climb
note: Use the Skultera to get onto the top right platform. There are two distinct ways to get up using the top Skultera.
1. Freeze it at the bottom of its path to the left. Crouch jump and down grab to get onto it. The positioning is very precise.
2. Freeze it about a half-tile from the right wall and very quickly stationary spin jump and quickly walljump mash to get up before it thaws.
This may be easier by jumping away from the wall, towards the fish, to gain height faster.

strats.name: G-Mode Deep Stuck X-Ray Climb
strats.note: Climb up 2 screens.

strats.name: Shinespark Deep Stuck X-Ray Climb
strats.note: Climb up 2 screens.

devNote: It is possible to X-ray climb higher, into a normally inaccessible area behind the door to Kassiuz Room.

This doesn't appear to be useful: the door transition there, which appears to lead back to the normal part of Plasma Spark Room, instead transitions to the same room as the bottom right door (to Butterfly Room).

strats.name: Suitless Shinespark
note: Start the dash as close to the door transition as possible to help avoid getting hit by the first Owtch. Store the shine charge while high up on the left slope.
Spark up while on the right side of the platform. To avoid the Owtch on the platform, it may help to jump on the left side of the platform then jump again and spark midair above the right side.
devNote: The excess frames are only low enough to get to the top right overhang, as it is free to jump to 5.
With other items or wall jumps and lower energy, it is possible to first spark to 1, as it has more excess frames.

strats.name: Shinespark
note: Shinespark from the left side of the water, or the very edge of the land.
It helps to face right before Shinesparking.

strats.name: Carefully Kill Choot
note: Shoot the Choot either before landing or from the safety of the ledge edge.
If bomb jumping, there is a timing for rolling under the Choot.

strats.name: Kill Choot and Reclimb
strats.note: To avoid damage, the Choot can be killed and then Samus can climb back up again.
strats.devNote: Missile kill strats could fit here with a reclimb or by landing on the ledge, with the same requirements.

strats.name: Shinespark
note: Shinespark from the tile to the right of the Choot.
It helps to face right before Shinesparking.

strats.name: Shinespark
note: A diagonal spark may take damage from the Choot
It helps to face right before Shinesparking.

to.devNote: This link is only for shinesparking. All other strats should go 4 -> 3 -> 5.

Bug Sand Hole Right Door (to Thread the Needle Room)

runways.name: Base Runway - Bug Sand Hole Right Door (to Thread the Needle Room)

farmCycles.name: Forget it
farmCycles.devNote: Leaving this logically unfarmable until further notice because it sucks

reusableRoomwideNotable.name: Bug Sand Hole Sand Jumps
note: Cross the Bug Sand Hole with nothing while avoiding the enemies.
Juke the Yapping Maw after entering and kill the Zoa to clear a path over the sand.

reusableRoomwideNotable.name: Bug Sand Hole Damage Boost
reusableRoomwideNotable.note: Wait inside the door frame of the Bug Sand Hole room while a Zoa rises out of the sand.  And using it to cross the room.

reusableRoomwideNotable.name: Bug Sand Hole Speedy Jump Morph
note: With a fast enough jump into the Bug Sand Hole it is possible to cross over the water and land in the opposite door by morphing before reaching the ceiling.

strats.name: Bug Sand Hole Suitless HiJump (L to R)
strats.note: Kill the Zoa while avoiding the Yapping Maw, then cross the sand. Spring ball can be used to help cross the sand.

strats.name: Bug Sand Hole Suitless Frozen Bridge (L to R)
note: Freeze the Zoa as it spawns and use it to cross the sand.
Freeze any Yapping Maws that attack and use them as platforms to leave.

strats.name: Bug Sand Hole Suitless Kill Yapping Maws (L to R)
Naked Bug Sand Hole Sand Jumps (L to R)
note: Avoid the Yapping Maw after entering by not standing in one place for too long.
Kill the Zoa and quickly jump across the sand.
Escape by wall jumping when the water is low or using a crouch jump and down grab when it's high.
Hitting the Zoas will drop Samus deep into the sand below.

strats.name: Naked Bug Sand Hole Damage Boost (L to R)
note: Avoid the Yapping Maw after entering by not standing in one place for too long.
Jump back into the entry door by wall jumping when the water is low or using a crouch jump and down grab when it's high.
Once the Zoa has risen out of the water, use it to damage boost into the open opposite door.

strats.name: Bug Sand Hole Space Jump (L to R)
note: Enter the room able to Space Jump
Requires shooting the door in midair, otherwise water is involved.
devNote: Space Jump once in the water does not provide advantages towards clearing the room other than not touching the sand.
The enemies must still be avoided and a walljump or downgrab is needed to reach a door.

strats.name: Bug Sand Hole Speedy Jump Morph (L to R)
strats.reusableRoomwideNotable: Bug Sand Hole Speedy Jump Morph
note: Build up run speed and jump into the transition to cross this room without touching the water.
Shoot open the opposite door upon entering and morph before touching the ceiling to bounce into the open door.

strats.name: Shinespark
strats.note: Enter with a high shinespark through the door then shoot the opposite door and fall into it.
strats.devNote: Representing the need to enter in a high spark with canPrepareForNextRoom and framesRemaining.

strats.name: Bug Sand Hole Suitless HiJump (R to L)
strats.note: Kill the Zoa while avoiding the Yapping Maw, then cross the sand. Spring ball can be used to help cross the sand.

strats.name: Bug Sand Hole Suitless Frozen Bridge (R to L)
note: Freeze the Zoa as it spawns and use it to cross the sand.
Freeze any Yapping Maws that attack and use them as platforms to leave.

strats.name: Bug Sand Hole Suitless Kill Yapping Maws (R to L)
Naked Bug Sand Hole Sand Jumps (R to L)
note: Avoid the Yapping Maw after entering by not standing in one place for too long.
Kill the Zoa and quickly jump across the sand.
Escape by wall jumping when the water is low or using a crouch jump and down grab when it's high.
Hitting the Zoas will drop Samus deep into the sand below.

strats.name: Naked Bug Sand Hole Damage Boost (R to L)
note: Avoid the Yapping Maw after entering by not standing in one place for too long.
Jump back into the entry door by wall jumping when the water is low or using a crouch jump and down grab when it's high.
Once the Zoa has risen out of the water, use it to damage boost into the open opposite door.

strats.name: Bug Sand Hole Space Jump (R to L)
note: Enter the room able to Space Jump
Requires shooting the door in midair, otherwise water is involved.
devNote: Space Jump once in the water does not provide advantages towards clearing the room other than not touching the sand.
The enemies must still be avoided and a walljump or downgrab is needed to reach a door.

strats.name: Bug Sand Hole Speedy Jump Morph (R to L)
strats.reusableRoomwideNotable: Bug Sand Hole Speedy Jump Morph
note: Build up run speed and jump into the transition to cross this room without touching the water.
Shoot open the opposite door upon entering and morph before touching the ceiling to bounce into the open door.

strats.name: Shinespark
strats.note: Enter with a high shinespark through the door then shoot the opposite door and fall into it.
strats.devNote: Representing the need to enter in a high spark with canPrepareForNextRoom and framesRemaining.

locks.name: Butterfly Room Grey Lock (to West Cactus Alley)

bypassStrats.name: Butterfly Room Door Lock Wall Ice Clip
bypassStrats.note: Repeatedly freeze the Zoas to slowly push Samus into the wall and through the locked doorway.
bypassStrats.devNote: The drops will keep Samus at high energy, but 2 hits enemy damage were added as a worst-case scenario where the next-to-last Zoa you kill doesn't give you energy.

nodes.name: Butterfly Room Top Sand Entrance (from Plasma Beach Quicksand Room)

reusableRoomwideNotable.name: Butterfly Room Careful Jump
note: Kill all the Zoas and don't pick up their drops. If the door is unlocked, stand in the doorframe and jump across the room.
Otherwise, jump across the sand, starting 1.5 tiles away from the sandfall. Hold jump and forward the whole time. Samus will dip into the sand, but still make it to the other side.

strats.name: Frozen Zoa Bridge
strats.note: Use the frozen Zoas as a bridge. Falling will require Samus to use ice beam and a crouch jump to escape.

strats.name: Suitless Bombs
strats.note: It is relatively easy to get out of the sand by rapidly placing bombs.

strats.name: Butterfly Room Careful Jump (Left to Right)
note: Kill all the Zoas and don't pick up their drops. If the door is unlocked, stand in the doorframe and jump across the room.
Otherwise, jump across the sand, starting 1.5 tiles away from the sandfall. Hold jump and forward the whole time. Samus will dip into the sand, but still make it to the other side.

strats.name: Butterfly Room Suitless Sand Escape (Left to Right)
note: It is possible to get out of the sand with nothing.
While holding down, crouch jump then press forward diagonal to clip into the wall enough to jump out.
strats.devNote: This will never be in logic because there are easier ways to cross the room, but can be used to escape the sand.

strats.name: Cross Room Jump with Bomb Boost
note: Only requires a runway of approximately 0.5 tiles in the adjacent room.
Bomb boost through the doorway and hold right.

strats.name: Frozen Zoa Bridge
strats.note: Use the frozen Zoas as a bridge. Falling will require Samus to use ice beam and a crouch jump to escape.

strats.name: Suitless Bombs
strats.note: It is relatively easy to get out of the sand with rapidly placing bombs.

strats.name: Butterfly Room Careful Jump (Right to Left)
note: Kill all the Zoas and don't pick up their drops. If the door is unlocked, stand in the doorframe and jump across the room.
Otherwise, jump across the sand, starting 1.5 tiles away from the sandfall. Hold jump and forward the whole time. Samus will dip into the sand, but still make it to the other side.

strats.name: Butterfly Room Suitless Sand Escape (Right to Left)
note: It is possible to get out of the sand with nothing.
While holding down, crouch jump then press forward diagonal to clip into the wall enough to jump out.
strats.devNote: This will never be in logic because there are easier ways to cross the room, but can be used to escape the sand.

strats.name: Cross Room Jump with Bomb Boost
note: Only requires a runway of approximately 0.5 tiles in the adjacent room.
Bomb boost through the doorway and hold right.

to.note: When entering the room from above, fall to either side and avoid the sand, as it may lead to a softlock. It's best not to turn around during the fall.
When entering the room from above, fall to either side and avoid the sand, as it may lead to a softlock. It's best not to turn around during the fall.

strats.name: Shinespark
strats.note: Use Hijump or one walljump on the left before a diagonal spark.

to.note: Only the the direct shinespark. Other strats should go 1 -> 2 -> 3.

strats.name: Kill Rippers Then IBJ
note: Only the lowest three Rippers that are above the right door need to be killed. The highest of the three can barely be reached with a Super and HiJump.
Or a PB placed slightly higher than a standard max jump, done by jumping from the door ledge, from an IBJ while avoiding the Ripper, or using 2 PBs.

strats.name: Maridia Elevator Room Wall Climb
strats.note: The walljumps are considered to require precision only if the Rippers are not killed

unlockStrats.name: Base
unlockStrats.note: To avoid redundant requirements, obstacle must be destroyed by going to 2->3->1.

nodes.name: Plasma Beam
Plasma Room Junction (Middle of Room with all Standing Pirates Dead)
nodes.note: Intended to logically separate killing the standing enemies (who have actual requirements) from climbing out of the room.

obstacles.name: Pink Pirates
obstacles.note: Enemies that must be cleared to unlock the room. Take note that the wall pirates do not have special immunities.

strats.name: Insane Walljump
strats.note: Lead the wallpirate into jumping across the room and dodge the standing pirate.

strats.name: HiJump Walljump
strats.note: Lead the wallpirate into jumping across the room and dodge the standing pirate.

strats.name: HiJump Speedjump
note: Watch the right-side standing pirate walk towards the wall as far as possible from below.
The available running space is just enough to jump up and walljump the ledge by the door.

strats.name: HiJump Speedjump with Damage
strats.note: Take a hit from the pirate to gain iframes for running through the pirate to use for a longer runway.

strats.name: Kill one then IBJ
strats.note: Pseudo screw the left pirate, or clear the left side with shinesparks, then IBJ out
strats.devNote: If you can kill them without being hurt, you can take path 2->3->1.

strats.name: Jump into IBJ
strats.note: Let the wall pirate jump to the otherside of the room.  Shooting the standing pirate (with anything) will prevent it from attacking.

strats.name: Kill Pirates With Shinesparks And Escape
note: Using the bottom of the room, shortcharge to use the echoes created by shinesparking to kill all of the Standing Pirates.
Either lead the pirate to the left wall or take a hit to gain iframes to use the full runway to charge a spark
To lead a pirate, have it shoot in the direction you want it to go.  Then jump overhead and crouch on the other side.
Turn around and diagonal spark the ceiling to kill the lowest pirate, and later the middle pirates.
Building a spark towards the left allows for enough run speed to jump to the middle level.
Then vertical shinespark out which kills the top pirate.
strats.devNote: Killing the top pirate naturally puts you at 1

strats.name: Frozen Wall Pirate Plasma Escape
note: Shoot at a wall pirate from below to freeze it.  Plasma is not required for wall pirates.
Firing at a Standing Pirate with anything will prevent it from shooting for a short time.

strats.name: Plasma Room Pseudo Screw
strats.note: The 4 standing pirates take 2 Pseudo Screws to kill each, so Samus must take 4 hits.  No damage is taken when the enemy dies.

strats.name: Frozen Wall Pirate Plasma Escape
note: It's possible to climb up with just ice by freezing the wall space pirates (who can be frozen and killed without Plasma).
Clearing the grey door lock would require killing the frozen pirate after using it to climb.

strats.name: Hjless Walljump
strats.note: This is the same size of ledge as writg.
